intro: Abrotanum, commonly known as wild thyme, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Lamiaceae. It consists of several species, including Abrotanum alpinum and Abrotanum fragrans, which are native to Europe and western Asia. These plants are characterized by their aromatic, small, pink or white flowers and opposite, hairy leaves. They typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are often found in alpine or mountainous regions. Abrotanum species are valued for their medicinal properties and have been used in traditional herbal remedies.
